software.work-history-description: I have over 6 years of experience working as a software engineer with companies of different sizes in different industries. Please reference my resume for an in-depth view of my professional work history.

gallery.climbing: I enjoy rock climbing, both indoors and outdoors. I mostly boulder, but am also top rope/lead certified and love crack climbing. This shot was captured in LCC by my world-cup photographer friend Gabriel Ramos
gallery.languages: I spend a lot of time learning languages - at the moment my focus has been to improve my German, however I also have an interest in Spanish, Norwegian, Icelandic, and Japanese.
gallery.vr: Projekt_1Q84 is a collaborative art and music space I co-developed in virtual reality with the talented artist Mordio
gallery.boutiki: Boutiki was a startup idea I built with my insanely entrepreneurial friend, David Cline
gallery.shaders: A Fractal Brownian Motion glsl shader I wrote awhile ago, using my own implementation of Ken Perlin's noise algorithm.
gallery.touchdesigner: Tunnel visual created with touchdesigner - eventually would like to create some audio-reactive and visual-reactive generative patches combined with my modular
gallery.perlin-noise: Terraria-style game I created in Unity forever ago that leveraged Perlin noise to procedurally generate realistic caves/tunnels and landscapes.
gallery.reading: I thoroughly enjoy reading, mostly sci-fi or science-related books. This image is from the website of the author of one of my favorite books, Diaspora by Greg Egan. https://www.gregegan.net/DIASPORA/DIASPORA.html
gallery.zerog: Zero Gravity was a mobile game I programmed when I was very young. One of the first big projects I finished and successfully launched. Sadly it is no longer available to download.
gallery.knights: Pixel Knights was an RPG style game I created once upon a time.
gallery.calculator: A transparent calculator I programmed that I found in my images on my old hard drive.
gallery.photography: Capturing photos and being in the mountains :)
gallery.oscilloscopeart: Some oscilloscope art I created with my data module. The favicon for this website is actually a scaled-down version of some oscilloscope art I made!

audio.sound-design-description: My first synthesizer was the semi-modular Dreadbox Erebus. Since then, I've worked with a huge variety of synthesizers, modules, drum machines, mixers, media players and other audio hardware. I'm also a member of the SLC Synth Alliance.
audio.sound-design-setup: Some of my current favorite modules are the Euclidean Circles v2 from vpme.de, Toppobrillo Multifilter, and Batumi Quad LFO. I also extensively use the Access Virus TI2 and several in-the-box VSTs to create the sounds I am looking for.
audio.live-sound-description: I've helped set up Funktion One sound systems, FFA amps, and booth monitors, assisting sound engineers in finding a balanced sound in a live environment.
audio.live-sound-description2: An aptitude for troubleshooting live performance equipment, including mixers and media players, and handling artist changeovers. I'm a big advocate for the use of hearing protection.
audio.performance-description: I also enjoy creating sets aligned with various themes, including audio / visual ambient art showcases.
audio.philosophy-in-sound: My philosophy regarding sound is based primarily around a sense of space, dynamics, rhythm, texture, and atmosphere.
